snippet: The owner of DCM Erectors is accused of fraudulently obtaining $76 million by falsely claiming he was in compliance with requirements for hiring minority and female subcontractors.
abstract: Contractor Larry Davis is charged in United States District Court in Manhattan with fraudulently obtaining $76 million by falsely claiming he was in compliance with Port Authority requirements for hiring minority and female subcontractors; Davis is owner of DCM Erectors, which was hired to do extensive steel work on 1 World Trade Center.
lead_paragraph: The owner of DCM Erectors is accused of fraudulently obtaining $76 million by falsely claiming he was in compliance with requirements for hiring minority and female subcontractors.

headline.main: Contractor for 1 World Trade Center Is Charged With Fraud

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
